data: Level 1 Single Body Surface is applicable only for 27+6 weeks and under
Phototherapy: Level 1: Single Body Surface, Overhead, Irradiance of 10 to 30 microwatts/cm2/nm
Phototherapy: Level 2: Single Body Surface, Overhead, Irradiance of 30 to 50 microwatts/cm2/nm
Phototherapy: Level 2: Single Body Surface, Blanket, Irradiance of 30 to 65 microwatts/cm2/nm

Phototherapy: Level 3: Double Body Surface, Blanket, Irradiance of 30 to 65 microwatts/cm2/nm for blanket, Overhead, Irradiance of 30 to 50 microwatts/cm2/nm for overhead, must use both blanket and overhead

Phototherapy: Level 4: Double Body Surface, Blanket, Irradiance of 30 to 65 microwatts/cm2/nm for blanket, Overhead, Irradiance of 50 to 70 microwatts/cm2/nm for overhead, for infants greater than or equal to 35 weeks and serum bilirubin near exchange transfusion threshold
